parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
A shepherd; hence met: of the feeder, protector, and ruler of a flock of men. Of uncertain affinity; a shepherd.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To spend the night in the open, bivouac. From agros and auleo; to camp out.
Feminine of a derivative of the base of chasma through the idea of empty expanse; room, i.e. A space of territory.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: Probably from phule through the idea of isolation; to watch, i.e. Be on guard; by implication, to preserve, obey, avoid.
From phulasso; a guarding or, the act, the person; figuratively, the place, the condition, or, the time, literally or figuratively.
On, to, against, on the basis of, at.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
A flock (of sheep or goats). Contraction from poimaino; a flock.
The night, night-time. A primary word; 'night'.
